page.title: 08Youth-Provision & Attitudes
page.content: Great concern was shown by adults for unemployed young people. "Youngsters have to move away to seek work. Many of those remaining get into trouble through boredom and take to drugs and thieving." "Public houses are being re-styled to appeal to young people and there is an increase in under-age drinking." A lack of certain leisure facilities was highlighted in our survey. "No leisure activites left for the young because of the closure of public baths in Livingstone st. Local parks are unsafe, no park police, play areas dominated by bullies and vandalised." People applauded the provision of some leisure centres but regretted having to travel long distances. This is the only way to have a swim. School children are bussed to Wallasey for swimming instruction.
